Description: Two fragments of papyrus bearing Coptic epistolary text. Left fragment is bearing a six lines of text written along the fibres (recto), right fragment is a five lines of text written along the fibres (recto) and one line against the fibres (verso). The two fragments and a linen strip are mounted together.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (706206) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/706206)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: fragment Black ink Repaired: kraft paper Repaired: glassine paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: leather Object Priority: B Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete - fragmentary)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Hon Sir Charles Augustus Murray
Acquisition notes: Murray was British Consul-General in Egypt.
